trans-unit.source: Implements a selectable item in a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeView"></xref> control.

<xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem> is a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.HeaderedItemsControl>, which means its header and collection of objects can be of any type (such as string, image, or panel).
For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.HeaderedItemsControl> class.

<xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem> controls can be embedded inside other <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem> controls to create a hierarchy of nodes inside a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeView> control.
The following illustration shows a hierarchy of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem> controls inside a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeView>.
![TreeView illustration](~/add/media/treeviewillustration.JPG "TreeView illustration")
To expand or collapse a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem>, use the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem.IsExpanded%2A> property.
For more information about the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeView> control, see the [TreeView Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/controls/treeview-overview.md).
Customizing the TreeViewItem Control
To apply the same property settings to multiple <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem> controls, use the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Style%2A> property.
You can modify the default <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate> to give the control a unique appearance.

For more information about creating a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate>, see [Customizing the Appearance of an Existing Control by Creating a ControlTemplate](~/docs/framework/wpf/controls/customizing-the-appearance-of-an-existing-control.md).
To see the parts and states that are specific to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem>, see [TreeView Styles and Templates](~/docs/framework/wpf/controls/treeview-styles-and-templates.md).
Dependency properties for this control might be set by the controlâ€™s default style.
If a property is set by a default style, the property might change from its default value when the control appears in the application.
The default style is determined by which desktop theme is used when the application is running.
For more information, see [Default WPF Themes](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=158252).
Setting a visual property will only have an effect if that property is both present in <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem> control's default template and is set by using a .

You can find a list of visual properties in the "Changing the Visual Structure of a Control" section in [Customizing the Appearance of an Existing Control by Creating a ControlTemplate](~/docs/framework/wpf/controls/customizing-the-appearance-of-an-existing-control.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem"></xref> class.
Arranges the content of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem"></xref>.
The final area within the parent that the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem"></xref> should use to arrange itself and its children.
The actual size used by the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem"></xref>.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem.IsExpanded"></xref> property changes from `true` to `false`.
This event occurs when a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem> is collapsed so that child elements are hidden.
Routed Event Information
Identifier field
Routing strategy
Bubbling
Delegate
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem.Collapsed"></xref> routed event.
The identifier for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem.Collapsed> routed event.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem.IsExpanded"></xref> property changes from `false` to `true`.
This event occurs when a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem> is expanded so that its child elements are visible.
Routed Event Information
Identifier field
Routing strategy
Bubbling
Delegate
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem.Expanded"></xref> routed event.
The identifier for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem.Expanded> routed event.
Expands the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem"></xref> control and all its child <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem"></xref> elements.
Creates a new <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem"></xref> to use to display the object.
A new <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem"></xref> to use to display the object.
Gets or sets whether the nested items in a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem"></xref> are expanded or collapsed.
The appearance of the button that expands and collapses the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem> changes when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem> is expanded or collapsed.
When the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem.IsExpanded%2A> property value changes from `true` to `false`, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem.Collapsed> event occurs.
Similarly, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem.Expanded> event occurs when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem.IsExpanded%2A> property value changes from `false` to `true`.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
`true` if the nested items of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem"></xref> are visible; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem.IsExpanded"></xref> dependency property.
The identifier for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem.IsExpanded%2A> dependency property.
Determines whether an object is a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem"></xref>.
The object to evaluate.
`true` if item is a ; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets whether a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem"></xref> control is selected.
When the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem.IsSelected%2A> property value changes to `true`, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem.Selected> event occurs.
When the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem.IsSelected%2A> property value changes to `false`, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem.Unselected> event occurs.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem"></xref> is selected; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem.IsSelected"></xref> dependency property.
The identifier for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem.IsSelected%2A> dependency property.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem"></xref> has keyboard focus.

If the keyboard changes focus from a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem> to a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Menu> or a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ToolBar>, the value of this property remains `true`.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem"></xref> has keyboard focus; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem.IsSelectionActive"></xref> dependency property.
The identifier for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem.IsSelectionActive%2A> dependency property.

Raises a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem.Collapsed"></xref> event when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem.IsExpanded"></xref> property changes from `true` to `false`.
The event arguments.
Defines an <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.TreeViewItemAutomationPeer"></xref> object for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem"></xref>.

Raises an <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem.Expanded"></xref> event when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem.IsExpanded"></xref> property changes from `false` to `true`.
The event arguments.
Provides class handling for the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.GotFocus"></xref> event.
This implementation sets the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeView> selection to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem> that is in focus.
The <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.GotFocus> event occurs when the value of the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.IsFocused%2A> property changes from `false` to `true`.
The event data.

Provides class handling for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemContainerGenerator.ItemsChanged"></xref> event that occurs when there is a change in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items"></xref> collection.
This implementation adjusts the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeView> selection when there is a change in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> collection.
The event data.
Provides class handling for a <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.KeyDown"></xref> event.
This method sets <xref:System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.Handled%2A> to `true` and collapses or expands the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem> when one of the following keys is pressed:
The event data.
Provides class handling for a <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.MouseLeftButtonDown"></xref> event.

If the mouse <xref:System.Windows.Input.MouseButtonEventArgs.ClickCount%2A> is two, the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem.IsExpanded%2A> property switches to `true` or `false`, which causes the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem> to expand or collapse.

This implementation marks the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.MouseLeftButtonDown> event as handled by setting the <xref:System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.Handled%2A> property of the event data to `true`.
The event data.

Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem.Selected"></xref> routed event when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem.IsSelected"></xref> property changes from `false` to `true`.
The control raises the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem.Selected> event by calling <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.RaiseEvent%2A>.
For more information, see [Routed Events Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/routed-events-overview.md).
The event arguments.

Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem.Unselected"></xref> routed event when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem.IsSelected"></xref> property changes from `true` to `false`.
The control raises the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem.Unselected> event by calling <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.RaiseEvent%2A>.
For more information, see [Routed Events Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/routed-events-overview.md).
The event arguments.
Responds to a change in the visual parent of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem"></xref>.
This implementation updates the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeView> <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeView.SelectedItem%2A> if <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem.IsSelected%2A> is `true`.
The previous visual parent.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem.IsSelected"></xref> property of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem"></xref> changes from `false` to `true`.
The event occurs when a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem> becomes the selected <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem> in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeView> control.

This event is related to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeView.SelectedItemChanged> event that occurs when there is a change in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeView.SelectedItem%2A> property of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeView> control.
Routed Event Information
Identifier field
Routing strategy
Bubbling
Delegate
Identified by the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem.Selected"></xref> routed event.
The identifier for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem.Selected> routed event.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem.IsSelected"></xref> property of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem"></xref> changes from `true` to `false`.

The event occurs when the selection changes from this <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem> to another <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem> in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeView> control.

This event is related to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeView.SelectedItemChanged> event that occurs when there is a change in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeView.SelectedItem%2A> property of a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeView> control.
Routed Event Information
Identifier field
Routing strategy
Bubbling
Delegate
Identified by the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem.Unselected"></xref> routed event.
The identifier for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem.Unselected> routed event.
Gets or sets an object that represents the viewport and cache sizes of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.IHierarchicalVirtualizationAndScrollInfo> interface.
An object that represents the viewport and cache sizes of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem"></xref>.
Gets an object that represents the desired size of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.HeaderedItemsControl.Header"></xref>, in pixels and in logical units.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.IHierarchicalVirtualizationAndScrollInfo> interface.
An object that represents the desired size of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.HeaderedItemsControl.Header"></xref>, in pixels and in logical units.
Gets a value that indicates whether the control's layout pass occurs at a lower priority.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.IHierarchicalVirtualizationAndScrollInfo> interface.
`true` if the control's layout pass occurs at a lower priority; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets an object that represents the desired size of the control's items, in pixels and in logical units.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.IHierarchicalVirtualizationAndScrollInfo> interface.
An object that represents the desired size of the control's items, in pixels and in logical units.

Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Panel"></xref> that displays the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items"></xref> of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.IHierarchicalVirtualizationAndScrollInfo> interface.

The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Panel"></xref> that displays the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items"></xref> of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem"></xref>.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the owning <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl"></xref> should virtualize its items.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.IHierarchicalVirtualizationAndScrollInfo> interface.
`true` if the owning <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl"></xref> should virtualize its items; otherwise, `false`.
